intro: Erigeron floribundus, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas such as fields and roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its foliage is usually hairy and gray-green, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
